field_edited_text.value:
Engineering Organization





THE engineering work for this program was done under the direct super-
vision of John E. Greiner, B.S., C.E., Sc.D., Dr.Eng., Hon. M. Am. Soc.
C.E. and Herschel H. Allen, B.S. in C.E., C.E., M. Am. Soc. C.E., members
of the firm of J. E. Greiner Company.

The following engineers were called in for special consultation work:—

Glennon Gilboy, S.B., S.M., Se.D., Assoc. M. Am. Soc. C.E., Assoc.
Prof. of Soil Mech., Mass. Inst. Tech. on Soil Analysis;

Ole Singstad, C.E., M. Am. Soc. C.E., Chief Engr. New York City
Tunnel Authority, for preparation of plans and estimates for
Patapsco River Tunnel,;

Thomas F. Comber, Jr., B.S. in C.E., M. Am. Soc. C.E., Assoc. Prof.
of Civ. Eng., The Johns Hopkins Univ., on special computations.

S. S. Steinberg, B.E., C.E., M. Am. Soc. C.E., Acting Dean, Coll. of
Eng., Univ. of Md., as surveys consultant and in general charge
of all surveys; and

Milton A. Pyle, B.S., in C.E., C.E., Asst. Prof. of Civ. Eng., Coll. of
Eng., Univ. of Md., as Engineer of Surveys.

The following members of J. E. Greiner Company’s staff were assigned
to head the engineering groups for each of the crossings:—

Edward Russell Allen, B.S. in C.E., Assoc. M. Am. Soc. C.E.;

Joseph K. Knoerle, B.S. in M.E., M.S., Assoc. M. Am. Soc. C.E.;
W. Calvert Roberts, A.B., C.E.

William H. Pahl, B.S. in C.E.

It was necessary to greatly expand the regular engineering force of J. E.
Greiner Company, in order to complete the engineering work on schedule.
In addition to the foregoing engineering executives, a force of eighty skilled
engineers, draftsmen, surveyors and junior assistants, working day and
night, were required to complete the engineering data embodied in this
report.
xxi
